Targeted: According to the US Embassy Website in Bangladesh as of Nov 11, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201111005505/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/:   "Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones. In these areas, the City Corporations will facilitate emergency response services.    It is important to note GoB officials have confirmed that the list of Red zones does not mean the areas are or will be under lockdown restrictions.    Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:  - **Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.**  - **Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.**  - **Residents must work from home.**  - **Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.**  - No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  - No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  - Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  - Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  - COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  - Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centres will be closed.  - Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  - Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  - ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  - Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  - Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations."    This information has not changed as of Nov 18, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122221519/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      IN GENERAL: COVID19-related restrictions seem be removed, although with strict adherence to mask wearing.  Dhaka Tribune: "On October 31, the Cabinet Division sent notices to all public offices of the country, asking them to restrict entry and to refuse service to anyone without a mask. The notice further said masks have been made compulsory for all offices, courts, shopping malls, bazaars, state or government buildings and **social events**."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122215536/https://www.dhakatribune.com/health/coronavirus/2020/11/02/no-restriction-on-public-movement-to-curb-second-wave-of-covid-19    Nov 12, reuters.com: "“The decision has been taken considering the second wave... We can’t play with the lives of our children,” said a senior official of the education ministry, who declined to be named. **The government however, has lifted most other restrictions**"  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122212335if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-bangladesh-educati/bangladesh-extends-school-shutdown-over-second-covid-19-wave-idUSKBN27S26A

“Emergency Powers (Covid 19 Pandemic) (No.11) (Amendment) Order, 2020.” made by the Prime Minister on November 10th addresses restrictions on internal movement.  “22. Inter-island travel.  (1) Every person desirous of inter island travel shall prior to travelling, apply for and obtain a travel health visa that shall be presented to the operator at the point of embarkation.  (2) A person travelling from New Providence shall be required, upon arrival on the other island, to submit to mandatory quarantine at a government identified facility or any other appropriate facility as determined by the Ministry of Health, at his own expense, for a period of fourteen days or for the duration of stay, if for a lesser period.”   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201116104644/https://www.bahamas.gov.bs/wps/wcm/connect/7831301e-9ceb-4dd1-ab98-7c1cacfd5816/Emergency+Powers+%28COVID+19+Pandemic%29%28No.11%29+%28Amendment%29+ORDER%2C+2020+%282%29.pdf?MOD=AJPERES

No change.   Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes  Botswana is divided into 9 geographical zones (map available at gov.bw) and permits are only needed to travel between zones. Residents may travel within their zone without permits.  Permits for inter-zone travel may be acquired online at gov.bw and are restricted to essential travel. COVID-19 tests may be required at any time for those transiting zones. Tourism is considered essential travel for economic reasons, and Botswana residents may organize permit applications with a reservation confirmation from their destination lodging.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201206230207/https://www.gov.bw/about-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206231725/https://bw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The federal and state governments call for unnecessary trips and visits to be avoided.  According to the decision taken by the Federal and Länder Governments, from 2 November until at least 20 December hotels and other accommodation providers may only provide overnight accommodation to people whose travel is essential. It is no longer permitted to provide overnight accommodation for tourism purposes. Visas for tourism purposes will thus only be issued in exceptional cases. It is expected that these restrictions will be in place until at least early January 2021.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207220918/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/informieren/alltag-gestalten/

The government's 'Entry to Greenland' page archived on August 10th was "updated on the 21st of July", which is the date the "Self-Government Executive Order no. 26 of 20 July 2020 on conditions for entry to Greenland (Phase 2)" came into effect.   The code has changed from 1G to 0 on July 21st because there are no further restrictions, required or recommended, on internal movement, for those who aren't recent entrants to Greenland.  However, the Executive Order describes required quarantine upon arrival into Greenland and related restrictions on internal movement "before it is considered proven that they [entrants to Greenland] are not infected with Covid-19". This movement restriction is specifically an international travel policy and therefore accounted for under international travel restrictions. C8-2 shows there is a quarantine policy in place.  "Your trip depends on your final destination   If you have passed a negative COVID-19 test before departure and filled in the SUMUT form, you can travel to the following cities without further restrictions.   The 10 towns and two villages are:   Municipality of Sermersooq   - Nuuk   - Paamiut   Qeqqata Municipality   - Sisimiut   - Maniitsoq   - Kangerlussuaq   Municipality Kujalleq   - Qaqortoq   - Narsaq   - Narsarsuaq   Municipality Qeqertalik   - Aasiaat   - Qasigiannguit   - Qeqertarsuaq   Avannaata Municipality   - Ilulissat   If your final destination is not figuerer above list you   Stay in the city with health center that is closest to your final destination.   If you have a home address in Greenland, you can contact the authorities regarding accommodation facilities for test results.   If you do not have an address in your final destination, you must maintain the expenses that may be associated with overnight stays, rebookings, board and lodging.   Contact your local health center and order a COVID-19 test to be performed at 5 p.m.   In the event of a negative test result, you can travel on to your final destination.   3. In the event of a positive result, you must go directly into isolation. The health center will contact the National Board of Health for further clarification of your situation."   Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200810150502/https://nun.gl/Emner/Borgere/Coronavirus_emne/Rejser_til_Groenland_fra_den_15_juni?sc_lang=da  (Entry to Greenland page) & http://web.archive.org/web/20201110102927/https://naalakkersuisut.gl/~/media/Nanoq/Files/Kundgoerelser/DK/2020/Bekendtgoerelser/Selvstyrets%20bekendtgrelse%20nr%2026%20af%2020%20juli%202020%20om%20betingelser%20for%20indrejse%20til%20Grnland%20Fase%202%20da.pdf (Executive Order)

dom_move-Notes: Libya's Tripoli-based internationally recognized Government of National Accord (GNA) has regularly imposed a complete four-day to week-long lockdown in the capital city due to a rise in coronavirus disease (COVID-19) cases. Further similar measures could likely be imposed in the coming days and weeks, depending on the disease activity. Authorities have also ordered the closure of stores, except those that provide essential goods and services. When a complete lockdown is not in place, officials impose a daily 2100-0600 curfew, with a 24-hour curfew on Fridays and Saturdays. Individuals and businesses that violate the edict may face fines.    Travel between cities in western Libya, the use of public transportation, social gatherings, and the operation of nonessential businesses remain prohibited until further notice. Businesses supplying essential goods and services remain operational.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201201053526/https://www.worldaware.com/warning-alert-authorities-libya-maintaining-varied-levels-covid-19-related-restrictions

Traveling in and out of industrial zones within the country seem to have targeted movement restrictions:  Nov 02, 2020: www.newsfirst.lk: "Sri Lanka Police introduced a Quarantine Curfew Pass application to be filled by those who require passes in order to resume operations at factories and other production centers"  sources:  - https://web.archive.org/web/20201115210122/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/11/02/quarantine-curfew-pass-application-for-industries-available-for-download/    other Govt. notices:  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)  - https://covid19.gov.lk/news/economy/issuing-of-curfew-passes-export-processing-zones.html (WaybackMachine was returning a 502 error when archiving this website)    However, internal movements across Sri Lanka, in general, seem to have no other concrete measures.  On Nov 9, according to an AP new report, "Passenger trains resumed operating after nearly two weeks and the government lifted a curfew that had been in effect in the capital, Colombo, and its suburbs."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201115204723/https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-sri-lanka-asia-arrests-colombo-0511a1a54f569364f2e8bdb901f42c79
No change:  https://web.archive.org/web/20201130205245/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/lesotho/coronavirus

dom_move-Notes: Lithuania’s government on Wednesday declared a three-week lockdown starting on Nov.7 (extended end of November), to slow the spread of the novel coronavirus which has accelerated in recent weeks in the Baltic nation.    "It is recommended to:    -restrict movement for non-essential reasons; leave the place of residence only for the purpose of work, shopping, health and other services;  -hold no private parties in private premises or to hold them with the participation of no more than 10 people wearing face masks;  -restrict close contact with members of other families and/or households or meet with members of no more than 2 families and/or households wearing masks."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201202092539/https://koronastop.lrv.lt/en/news/covid-19-related-restrictions-updated-on-25-november-2020

dom_move-Notes: The government of Nepal loosened the lockdown in the Kathmandu Valley. However, the government implemented an alternating day even/odd system for the movement of private vehicles based on the last number of the vehicle’s license plate.  Limited long-range public bus transportation  is allowed to operate at 50% capacity and is subject to strict COVID mitigation measures.  The government announced that trekking routes may be opened beginning October 17. Travelers must present negative PCR test results to be eligible for trekking and may be subject to quarantine.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201020230202/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-2/
